You gotta appreciate the interesting intersection of people you'll find here too- during the day it's tourists with their shorts and windbreakers on or suits walking to work in the FiDi and the madness of pink bags in Chinatown. At night it's hustlers on Broadway, bridge and tunnelers and a little bit of everyone from the city in the bars on Grant. Growing up in the suburbs, if my family wanted to go into the city for dinner and people watching, we'd come to North Beach. Heading out to the bars now, I love to see the families sitting in cafes.
author: Margaux N.

description: I live just up the street  from the heart of NB and i have to say it's such a fun, vibrant and eclectic neighborhood. It's a hodge podge of different people.  Tons of tourist catching a  bite at the standard NB italian restaurants.  There are cute little stores to but clothes/accessories. I like the cafes right by washington square park.  You can grab a cup of joe and just hang out and enjoy people watching. If nudie bars are your thing, they have some of that here.  It adds an interesting flavor to the neighborhood.  Nightlife, can sometimes get a bit rowdy with the kids/hoodlums making a scene at the clubs on broadway.  Overall, I still think NB rocks!
author: Ka C.

description:
I happily live in North Beach. 
It truly is the best neighborhood in San Francisco -- Monday through Thursday.  Weekends are Hell.
author: David L.

description: I like coming here o hot day it reminds me of Italy.  There are lot of tourist like the Italian, Germans and French that comes here.  Alot of hot Asian Italian here walking around or working near the shop at Grant and Columbus st.  Alot of bars and strip Joints on Broadway.  More restaurants and bar around Washington Square.
author: John F.

description: This is more like it. The longer I live here the better it gets. My cousin sent me an email and said that I just had to try this place. I just knew he had a purpose in life and that is to help me find good places to eat. Although this place is quite far from my work I managed to make it in an hour. I will definitly mark this as a fave. I had a pasta seafood dish with alfredo sauce that was divine, oooooo so yummmyy. Service was so fast it almost seemed like they were trying to get me out the door to make room for more customers. I'm not much of a wine drinker but they do have a great selection of wines. Another great positive dining expierence here in SF.
author: Carlie R.

description:
I've been living in the neighborhood for a little over a decade and I do love it.  But I do not love the amount of crime.  And I feel it's been getting worse every year.
Shootings at night clubs and gun fire that I hear at night (no, it's not just firecrackers.  those were gun shots.), fights on the streets (sure, drunk out-of-towners having a little too much fun along Broadway), pedestrians getting hit by cars (I've been the victim of a hit-and-run on my bike.  I wasn't hurt, but I don't ride it much anymore.).  
Theft (my car has been stolen twice.  radio is long gone.  Torn right out of the dash.  Along with most of the dashboard, thanks. why would the second thief break into and steal an old car with no radio?)
Car windows broken and little cubes of blue glass all over the street curbs.  Lots of broken car windows on the streets and sidewalks.  (Walk down Bay Street over by the water processing plant.)
And the homeless situation is really bad.  Both the people just sitting on the sidewalks asking for change and the scary ones with few teeth and sores on their faces staggering down Columbus in a drug stupor.
Sure, it's city-living, but it's not the charming, beatnik-flavored neighborhood you think it is.  Just being honest.  Our ability to ignore dying people on our city streets is tough to handle.  I think that untreated mental illness is a contributing factor as well and that's something that scares most people from helping too.
And I could do without the vomiting tourists at 3AM outside my window too as they stumble back the wharf hotels.
Otherwise, the food's great.  Bars are fun.  And parking sucks. 
Finally, housing prices aren't worth what sellers think a creaky old 100 year old building is worth.
I feel sad that my neighborhood is just not safe anymore.
Please watch your surroundings and you'll probably be o.k.
author: Kev M.

description: Hands down, my favorite San Francisco neighborhood. It's SO quaint and great for people watching, walking around and hanging out. On a nice Sunday afternoon, grabbing a drink and sitting outdoors is the bomb. There are so many great restaurants and bars here that the night kind of unfolds if you just get yourself in this neighborhood. Love it/
author: Hanan H.

description: Lived here, transferred in my job to New Mexico and missed it so much.  Quit and moved back.  The neighbors, the "characters", friends, restaurants and the feeling of community.  I know there is a whole city out there but this is the "hood" and I love it
author: Charee L.

description:
nice to VISIT... and then LEAVE.

great fresh pasta at palermo's deli, though.  also, the trader joe's is relatively quiet.

nay to the rest.
author: Maggie D.

description: For those of you don't read the news blogs, let me let you in on a little something. North Beach is not what it was three years ago. Now it's a crime ridden scary place to be, with cop cars outnumbering pedestrians. Just ask the cab drivers. If you can find one because even they are staying away! Recently it took me 30 minutes to even find one and when I finally did, I asked the cabbie what was up. His answer? NB is too ghetto. Why just last week a 65 year old man was robbed as he was coming home from a market at 11pm. So beware and plan to wait a good long while for a ride home.
author: a p.

description: I northbeach is really nice. You can see the Coit Tower from a distance. It's a really nice place to live. There's tons of touristy restaurants, gelato, and right next to Chinatown. I try to avoid the hilly streets though. ;)
author: V N.

description: It's not a big deal this North Beach. My friends play Rollersoccer (WWW.Rollersoccer.com) in North Beach every single Saturday. The location Is random, to me. Although I do have fun when I come here, I don't know why it's in North Beach because it could be anywhere. It is Zach who decides the location, Soccerballhead. I don't like it being there most of the time b/c its just way too hard getting over there w/ my rollerblades. It used to be fun to go dancing there but the clubs come and go too fast. I don't like it much no big deal.
author: fuck you p.

description: North Beach is a very eclectic neighborhood - and very much so dedicated to staying a neighborhood.  its definetely old and could use a bit cleaning, but i llve here on my own and feel safe to come and go and do not feel like its a dangerous place to live.
author: M J.

description:
i love north beach at night.  well, i love the way it looks with the pretty xmas lights and dimly lit restaurants.  however, the frat guys and drunk screechy girls that come here on weekends from god knows where, ruin the whole experience.  i am part italian so i feel some weird affinity being in north beach.  ok i'm a dork, but my maternal grandfather was second generation italian and born and raised in sf.  so yeah.  

all that being said, sodini's is a great restaurant and i enjoy 2 of the bars and city lights of course. so i guess the idea of north beach is nice, but the actual outcome leaves some to be desired.
author: Kate W.

description: The BEST location to live near Pier 39 in San Francisco!!! After living in Downtown for almost 2 years, I thought it was time to move to somewhere nicer and cleaner. I chose North Beach and it turned out I wasn't mistaken! That last year in SF was my best year! I lived right under the hill of Coit Tower; steps away from it...seriously! The rent for my 1 bedroom was $1500. On the weekend, I'd walked east to Steps of Rome (in Little Italy) to do my homework while enjoying fresh espresso, south to Washington Park to play volleyball with "strangers", or west to Pier 39. All I can say is......RETIRE HERE AND YOU'LL BE HAPPY FOREVER!!!
author: DAVID W.

description: What the fuck is going on?  Why does North Beach look like shit nowadays?  Have you been here at night lately?  It looks like the back of a fucking garbage truck.  Who is coming to my city and littering all over this neighborhood (I mean actual litter and people)?  GO HOME AND STAY THERE.  With all the fucking cops around on a Saturday night, I'm thinking, "Is some shit going down?  I better get my ass home before there's a drive-by and I'm stuck there giving an alibi."
author: Lily T.

description: North beach is where most of the Italian restaurants are at . There's also some cute boutiques . I like Grant St in North Beach because it's kind of hidden . North Beach is basically a pretty quiet neighborhood . There's a recreation center in the neighborhood as well as a park - Washington Square ; where people all take their dogs to play .
author: Eileen L.

description: I heart North Beach, I always have, unfortunately I have not had the chance to actually live in the neighborhood.  But I would! Yes there are strip clubs, yes the place can get annoying on weekends, however, there is always this magic about North Beach that many other neighborhoods do not have.
author: Amanda P.

description:
For an afternoon or a day at north beach, following article describes a good starting point:

http://locomotoring.net/2009/03/11/a-day-at-the-north-beach-sfo/

Btw, the walk to Coit Tower may be a bit steep for some but is definitely worth it. I also think that the St Peter and Paul church is a great spot for night photography.
author: Mishti D.

description:
i think i never really appreciated north beach until this year.. its not even the cafes, stores, or the parks.. i think its all the random streets, and alleys that i never got to see around the north beach neighborhood.  i think u should walk around the streets around the surround the stores..

yeah.. the tourists are annoying at times, but when u walk around north beach during off peak hrs, u'll absorb the culture of Italian Americans a lil more and appreciate North Beach a whole lot more..
author: Carlo M.

description: my favorite. hands down. even the tourists can't ruin it. even the hooligans can't ruin it.
author: Brian B.

description: I went here because my cousin said it was really good. I was impressed by the pizza because i know he will eat anything. We got half pepperoni and half Hawaiian. I really enjoyed the pizza and when i go back to SF i will probably go back here for some pizza.
author: Garrett L.

description: Classic old school culture, with a hip scene.  I like it a lot... simply cause Bimbo's is there, it is centrally located... and frankly... the real reason is because I spent about 9 hours drunken to all hell in a Santa Costume last year for Santacon, and we crashed a wedding.  Frankly... that was in the top 10 best days of my life.  Straight up.
author: Uncle Fishbits Aeneas X.

description: This is a great place to try out new restaurants, get some gelato, and browse at some really cute boutiques. Go with friends, girlfriends, boyfriends, and even kids.  Don't let the strip clubs deter you from coming to a lively and friendly neighborhood.
author: Mel P.

description: I'm a particular fan of my neighborhood.  I have WashPark to take my dog, two grocery stores 6 blocks away on Bay, within walking distance, a nice natural food stores around the corner, a bazillion bars to keep me satiated, and some very great restaurants buried in the tourist traps.  Even on top of that, I have friendly homeless neighbors that look after me and make me feel comfortable in my own little nook in the city.
author: Lindsay T.

description: I used to live here above city lights so I have to give this neighberhood some love...Tosca is awesome especially on Sunday nights when you can smoke inside...a house cap and an american spirit light was my night cap of choice for months when I lived here...the views of the downtown skyline from most apartments is wonderful and the food at firenze by night is killer....Also most of the bars open at 6 AM which is definately another perk...and Chinatown is so close as well!
author: Francis K.

description: This is the neighborhood that i call home. It pains me that North Beach has a bad reputation, which is created mostly by people who don't live here. Friday and Saturdays are without a doubt doucebag central. I wish that people could see North Beach during the week. I think there is no neighborhood more community based in the city. It's so nice to walk out of my house and actually know my neighbors by name and want to talk to them. With some of the best restaurants, sights and bars right outside my door I am proud to call NB my hood.
author: mike m.

description:
I could gush and gush about North Beach in passionate, most likely incoherent, run on sentences separates by ellipsis and commas. Instead, I'll just make a list of why North Beach is the SF neighborhood I have fallen deeply, madly in love with:

-Great sense of community. Even amidst countless tourists, you still see the same faces at the coffee shops or at Washington Square park.

-Amazing restaurants

--Adorable, quality caffes

-Touristy places as well as old-world Italian restaurants (gotta love the kitschy mixed with the traditional)

-Friendly folks and their dogs

-I love that in the morning I am greeted by Chinese people doing tai chi in the park as I leave my apartment. I love that at night when I'm coming home to my apartment, the drunken SF youth wander the streets in search of their next bar destination. Seriously, I love that kind of duality in a neighborhood.

-Great nightlife

-It's versatility--pleasant and cheery by day, sometimes sexy and sometimes funky at night. 

-Many cute boutiques, funky vintage stores as well

-A mix of residents, but mostly young. I like that my neighbors are both the old Italian woman who runs the bakery down the street as well as the sexy young couple


 North Beach has this indescribable quality, a feeling you get walking around its sidestreets and steep hills that you're in a true community. The people here know each other, but life is never boring. You're in San Francisco!! 

Man, I love North Beach.
author: Nicole R.

description: This 'hood is living on fumes - sure Dimaggio married Marilyn Monroe here - sure there USED to be a vibrant Italian immigrant community here decades ago but it's best days are obviously in the past and until a new group becomes dominant enough to claim title to the place today it shall remain "in transition" which means carry pepper spray when walking around here at night and don't forget the purell...
author: Quartknee K.

description: Where else can you have a piping hot plate of pasta, buy some homemade salami, get various varieties of homemade fucacca, watch American or Italian sports in a local bar, see one of the city's oldest book stores, and partake in the anual festiville that pays omage to the very neighborhood it is held in, all while still being in a neighborhood that attracts locals and tourists alike while feeling like in Italy  while in SF?  North Beach my pizanos.!
author: Brian S.

description: north beach is a puzzle to me. during the day, it's super cute with it's cafes and bistros. at night, its full of drunken frat boys and girls in cotton lycra "clubwear" dresses from forever 21 and shady thug people? yuck.
author: NF T.

description:
i live, technically, in russian hill... but columbus is a block east of me.  i stroll up and down columbus all the time, and around the washington square park area.  i've bought a dress from the romanian woman on grant who makes all her own funky designs.  i love eating at mama's when i have the patience to wait it out.  i love the feeling of security, being a girl who lives alone, scramblin' up and down columbus at any time of the night or morning, at whatever level of sobriety.  i've never felt threatened here.  ever.  not once.  i've explored the area with a few friends.  gino and carlo's is a good place to go and shoot some pool.  there's a store in the area that sells instruments and refurbished receivers and amps which is always fun to browse in.  vesuvio, right next to city lights, is really nice on the second floor (i scrambled into city lights quite drunkenly after many glasses of wine at vesuvio and walked out with 5 books -- one of which is "Food Politics" - yeah, i'll be reading THAT some time soon... yawn)  and the stoop on kearny and fresno - that view.  sigh.  also, 901 columbus cafe.  i love hangin' out in there.  the counter service is super excellent (and usually, so is the music).  however, i wish their salads came with more... salad?  i got a mountain of cheese and dried cranberries the other evening, hiding the maybe 7 pieces of lettuce underneath.  stick with the sandwiches and baked goodies.  excellent chai.

however... as a general rule, i'm not too crazy for italian food.  so let's see, that limits me to two taquerias, a french bakery, a "latin foods" place and a handful of cafes..?  hmm.  thanks, guys.  another thing... i'm a big fan of natural juices and there is virtually NOWHERE to get this around here.  juicey lucy's?  please.  i have never ONCE seen an actual sign of life in that place.  rent must be expensive in that spot.  must be nice to be able to own a store you never tend to and still manage rent.  i did read about a market called The Nature Shop on grant between green and vallejo.  they supposedly make juices.  i'll edit this once i've been through.

all in all, the security, nightlife and overall prettiness of the area gets the three stars for sure.  and the conveniece of it being "my hood", essentially.

the sore lack of variety and vegetarian-friendly restaurants knocks off two stars because that's big big BIG in my book.  my lease runs up soon and i don't plan on staying in the area.  i need to live somewhere with way more variety than this.  i'll definitely visit for the favorite haunts, though!
author: Beccie F.

description: I live in North Beach and its a fabulous neighborhood.  Its a place where people know one another if you live in the community.  I use to think I could never live in North Beach because it seemed so touristy.  I was wrong!!  Once you are a local you begin to see it's true qualities.  The friendly merchants when you become a regular.  The amazing food, cafes, bars, clothing shops, etc.  North Beach has so much to keep you entertained with everyday.  The park is a great place to escape to on a sunny day!  Plus there is a great community center nearby.  I can't imagine living in another neighborhood and I've live in several during my 8 years in the city.
author: Allison M.

description: This is one of the more authentic Italian restaurants in North Beach. If you are trying to get away from those tourist traps that charge way more than they are worth come here. The has always been great and the wine list is complimentary to the food.
author: Jennifer A.

description: a melange of i-talian, chinatown, and wacky broadway.
